HP.definition: A measure of how much damage a character or creature can take before falling unconscious or dying. When HP reaches 0, the entity is defeated.

AC.definition: A number representing how difficult it is to hit a creature with an attack. Higher AC means better defense. Attacks must meet or exceed AC to hit.

Challenge.definition: A measure of how difficult a monster is to defeat. Higher CR indicates a tougher enemy. CR 0.25 is very weak, while CR 5+ is a serious threat.

Roll.definition: Random number generation using dice notation (e.g., 1d20 means roll one 20-sided die). Used to determine outcomes of actions, attacks, and checks.

Modifier.definition: A number added to or subtracted from a dice roll. Represents bonuses from abilities, equipment, or circumstances. Can be positive or negative.

HitDie.definition: The die used to determine how much HP a character gains per level. Different classes use different hit dice (d6, d8, d10, or d12).

Initiative.definition: Determines the order in which characters and creatures take their turns in combat. Usually rolled at the start of an encounter using a d20.

Level.definition: A measure of a character or creature's power and experience. Higher levels mean more HP, better abilities, and greater strength. Ranges from 1 to 20.

Attack.definition: A d20 roll to determine if an attack hits its target. The result plus modifiers is compared to the target's AC. Meeting or exceeding AC means a hit.

Damage.definition: The amount of HP reduced when an attack hits. Determined by rolling damage dice (e.g., 1d8) plus any modifiers.

Heal.definition: Restoring lost Hit Points through magic, potions, or rest. Healing cannot raise HP above the maximum value.

Class.definition: A character's profession or calling. Determines their abilities, hit die, armor proficiency, and role in the party (e.g., Fighter, Wizard, Rogue).

Loot.definition: Treasure, items, and rewards found after defeating enemies or exploring. Can include weapons, armor, currency, or magical items.

Rarity.definition: Indicates how common or valuable an item is. Ranges from Common (basic items) to Legendary (extremely rare and powerful artifacts).

Turn.definition: A player or creature's opportunity to act during combat. On their turn, they can move, attack, cast spells, or perform other actions.

Encounter.definition: A combat scenario where players face enemies. Typically involves initiative, turn order, and resolving attacks until one side is defeated.
